
# A. Full EULA (Sample — adapt & review with counsel)

**END-USER LICENSE AGREEMENT (EULA)**
**[Product Name]** — **2.8.7**
**Effective Date:** 14/11/1025
**Time**: 03:55 Night

This End-User License Agreement (“Agreement”) is a legal contract between you (an individual or a single entity, “Licensee” or “You”) and **[Company Name]** (“Licensor”, “we”, “us”) governing your use of the software and services provided by Licensor, including the executable application(s), related documentation, APIs, plug-ins, modules, libraries, and online services (collectively, the “Software”).

## 1. Definitions

* **Software:** All code, binaries, installers, scripts, documentation, data, user interfaces, APIs, updates, and any hosted or cloud components that Licensor provides.
* **License Key:** any activation code or credential used to enable licensed features.
* **Confidential Information:** non-public technical, business, or security information disclosed by a party.
* **Vulnerability:** a security weakness or flaw in the Software that may permit unauthorized access, escalation, information disclosure, or other security incidents.

## 2. License Grant

Subject to the terms of this Agreement and payment of any applicable fees, Licensor grants Licensee a **non-exclusive**, **non-transferable**, **revocable** license to install and use one copy of the Software for Licensee’s internal business purposes only, in accordance with the Documentation and any license tier chosen (e.g., Free, Pro, Enterprise).

## 3. Permitted Uses

Licensee may:

* Install and run the Software on authorized devices or cloud instances for its internal cybersecurity operations (e.g., scanning, monitoring, analysis).
* Use APIs and reports produced by the Software in Licensee’s business processes.
* Make backup copies strictly for archival or disaster recovery, provided Licensor’s copyright and license notices remain intact.

## 4. Restrictions & Prohibited Uses

Except as permitted above, Licensee shall not, and shall not permit others to:

* Reverse engineer, decompile, disassemble, or attempt to derive source code from the Software, except as expressly permitted by applicable law that cannot be waived.
* Modify, adapt, translate, or create derivative works of the Software.
* Rent, lease, sublicense, distribute, sell, publish, transfer, or otherwise make the Software available to third parties except as expressly permitted in a separate written agreement.
* Use the Software to perform any illegal activities, unauthorized network intrusions, offensive cyber operations, or activities that violate third-party rights or privacy laws.
* Bypass, disable, or circumvent security or licensing controls in the Software.
* Use the Software to test, probe, or attack systems without explicit written authorization from the system owner (no unauthorized pentesting).

## 5. Responsibilities & Safe Use

* Licensee is responsible for obtaining and maintaining all permissions and authorizations required to run scans, probes, or any active testing using the Software.
* Licensee must follow all applicable laws and regulations, and industry-accepted safe testing practices.
* Licensee must not expose the Software’s internal services or management interfaces to the public internet without appropriate protections.

## 6. Vulnerability Disclosure & Coordinated Disclosure Policy

* If Licensee or any third party discovers a Vulnerability in the Software, they should report it to Licensor via the designated channel: **security@[company].com** (or other contact provided).
* Licensor will acknowledge reports within [72] hours and will coordinate a responsible disclosure timeline. Licensee agrees to coordinate any public disclosure with Licensor to permit remediation.
* Licensor may provide patches, mitigations, and public advisories as appropriate.

## 7. Third-Party Components & Open-Source

* The Software may include third-party libraries or open-source components governed by their own licenses. Those component licenses (e.g., MIT, Apache 2.0, GPL) are independent; Licensee must comply with their terms. A third-party components notice file is included in Documentation.

## 8. Updates, Upgrades & Support

* Licensor may provide updates or upgrades. Licensor is not obligated to provide support unless a separate support agreement exists.
* Automatic updates may be enabled by default; Licensee may be able to disable them in configuration settings, subject to terms of the support contract.

## 9. Fees & Payment

* Use under paid license tiers requires timely payment of fees. Failure to pay may result in suspension or termination of Licensee’s license.
* All fees are non-refundable except as required by applicable law or a specific refund policy provided by Licensor.

## 10. Data, Telemetry & Privacy

* The Software may collect diagnostic, performance, and usage telemetry (e.g., version, crash reports, usage metrics). Licensed features that transmit data to Licensor must be disclosed in the Privacy Notice.
* Licensee data remains the property of Licensee; Licensor will only process Licensee data to provide the Software and services and will abide by the Privacy Policy and applicable data protection laws (e.g., GDPR, PDPA).
* Licensor will take commercially reasonable measures to protect Licensee data but Licensee must maintain appropriate backups.

## 11. Intellectual Property

* Licensor retains all ownership, title and interest in the Software and any modifications or derivative works created by Licensor.
* Licensee obtains only the license rights expressly granted in this Agreement. No ownership rights are transferred.

## 12. Export Compliance

* Licensee shall comply with all applicable export control laws. Licensee shall not export, re-export, or transfer the Software except in compliance with applicable export laws and regulations.

## 13. Confidentiality

* Each party will keep confidential the other party’s Confidential Information and will not disclose or use it except as necessary to perform under this Agreement and subject to permitted disclosures required by law.

## 14. Warranties & Disclaimers

* **Limited Warranty:** For [30] days from delivery, Licensor warrants that the Software will materially conform to the Documentation. Licensor’s sole obligation will be to use commercially reasonable efforts to correct reported non-conformities.
* **Disclaimer:** EXCEPT FOR THE LIMITED WARRANTY ABOVE, THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED “AS-IS” WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND. LICENSOR DISCLAIMS ALL OTHER WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, NONINFRINGEMENT, OR THAT THE SOFTWARE WILL BE ERROR-FREE OR SECURE.

## 15. Limitation of Liability

* TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, IN NO EVENT WILL LICENSOR BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES (INCLUDING LOST PROFITS, LOST DATA, LOSS OF BUSINESS) ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT OR THE USE OF THE SOFTWARE, EVEN IF LICENSOR HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.
* LICENSOR’S AGGREGATE LIABILITY FOR ANY CLAIM ARISING FROM THIS AGREEMENT SHALL NOT EXCEED THE AMOUNTS PAID BY LICENSEE TO LICENSOR FOR THE SOFTWARE IN THE [12] MONTHS PRECEDING THE CLAIM (OR, IF NONE PAID, USD $100).

## 16. Indemnification

* **By Licensee:** Licensee will defend and indemnify Licensor from losses arising out of Licensee’s misuse of the Software, unauthorized testing, or breach of applicable law.
* **By Licensor:** Licensor will defend and indemnify Licensee against claims that the Software as delivered infringes third-party intellectual property rights, subject to remedies of replacement or modification.

## 17. Term & Termination

* This Agreement remains in force until terminated. Licensor may terminate or suspend the license if Licensee breaches any material term, fails to pay fees, or engages in prohibited uses.
* Upon termination, Licensee must cease use of the Software and destroy all copies; however, surviving provisions (IP, disclaimers, liability limitations, confidentiality, indemnity) will continue.

## 18. Governing Law & Dispute Resolution

* This Agreement is governed by the laws of **[jurisdiction, e.g., State of California / Republic of Indonesia]** without regard to conflict of law principles.
* Parties will attempt good-faith negotiation; disputes not resolved within [60] days may be submitted to binding arbitration in **[venue]** or to the exclusive courts of **[jurisdiction]**, as selected by Licensor (adapt per corporate policy).

## 19. Miscellaneous

* **Entire Agreement:** This Agreement, Documentation, and any supplemental ordering documents are the entire agreement.
* **Severability:** Any invalid provision will be reformed to the minimum extent required.
* **Assignment:** Licensee may not assign rights without Licensor’s written consent.
* **Notices:** Notices shall be sent to the addresses specified in the Documentation.

## 20. Contact Information

For legal or security inquiries, contact:
**Security & Legal:** dwibakti76@gmail.com
**Mail:** Dwi Bakti N Dev
**Phone:** +6289652969323

**Copyright © [Year] [Company Name]. All rights reserved.**

# B. Bullet-Point Summary (Key Points — English)

* **License Type:** Non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable license for internal use.
* **Permitted Use:** Install/run for internal cybersecurity tasks (scanning, monitoring, analysis). Backups allowed.
* **Prohibited Use:** No reverse engineering, redistribution, selling, unauthorized pentesting, or bypassing security/licensing.
* **Authorization:** Licensee must obtain permission before conducting active tests against third-party systems.
* **Vulnerability Disclosure:** Report via designated security channel (e.g., security@[company].com). Licensor will acknowledge; coordinated disclosure encouraged.
* **Data & Telemetry:** The app may collect telemetry; privacy policy governs data use. Licensee retains ownership of their data.
* **Third-Party Components:** Some components may be open source—comply with those licenses.
* **Support & Updates:** Provided only if specified (or as per support contract); updates may be automatic.
* **Fees & Payments:** Paid tiers require timely payment; nonpayment can suspend the license.
* **Warranty:** Limited 30-day warranty (example) — otherwise “AS-IS”.
* **Liability Cap:** Licensor’s liability limited to fees paid in prior 12 months (or a stated minimum). No liability for indirect/ consequential damages.
* **Indemnity:** Licensee indemnifies Licensor for misuse; Licensor indemnifies for IP infringement claims under limited conditions.
* **Export & Compliance:** Licensee must obey export laws and all applicable regulations.
* **Termination:** Licensor may terminate for breach; surviving clauses continue (IP, indemnity, liability).
* **Governing Law:** Specify jurisdiction (company choice) and dispute resolution method (arbitration or courts).


# C. Additional Clauses Recommended for Cybersecurity Apps

1. **Authorized Use & Pentesting Policy:** Explicit guidance on what constitutes authorized testing; require written consent before running intrusive scans against third-party networks.
2. **Safe Defaults & Configuration:** Recommend safe default settings (e.g., dry-run modes, rate limits, anonymization) and highlight user responsibilities for enabling aggressive features.
3. **Logging & Forensics:** State whether Licensor logs telemetry that might include event metadata and under which circumstances Licensor may access or disclose it (e.g., legal process).
4. **Supply Chain Security Statement:** Explain code signing, update integrity, and how updates are delivered (signed artifacts, hashes).
5. **Incident Response Cooperation:** Require cooperation in case of incidents, define SLAs for critical vulnerabilities for paid customers.
6. **Compliance Certification Notices:** If applicable, provide support for compliance standards (e.g., SOC2, ISO27001) and disclaim scope.



# D. Suggested Copyright & License Notice (short — include in UI/README)


© 2025 dwi bakti n dev.
Licensed under the [Company Name] End-User License Agreement (EULA).
Vulnerabilities: Please report to dwibakti76@gmail.com



# E. Quick Implementation Checklist (for product team)

* Add EULA acceptance during installation/first run.
* Include a copy of the EULA in installer, help menu, and website.
* Publish a clear Vulnerability Disclosure Policy and contact email.
* Provide a third-party license file listing OSS components.
* Ensure telemetry and privacy notice are visible and comply with regional laws.
* Implement license enforcement (keys or server checks) consistent with privacy obligations.
* Route legal/security contacts to a monitored mailbox and set an SLA for acknowledgements.


If you want, I can:

* Convert the full EULA into a ready-to-print PDF or Markdown file, or
* Produce a shorter “user summary” (plain English, one page) for end users, or
* Provide a specialized clause set for **open-source** vs **commercial** licensing, or
* Localize the EULA to Indonesian (Bahasa Indonesia).
